title: XML Separates Data from Presentation
text: XML does not carry any information about how to be displayed.
The same XML data can be used in many different presentation scenarios.

Because of this, with XML, there is a full separation between data and 
presentation.

title: XML is Often a Complement to HTML
text:
In many HTML applications, XML is used to 
store or transport data, while HTML is used to format and display the 
same data.

title: XML Separates Data from HTML
text: When displaying data in HTML, you should not have to edit the HTML file when the data changes.
With XML, the data can be stored in separate XML files.

With a few lines of JavaScript code, you can read an XML file and update 
the data content of any HTML page.

title: Transaction Data
text: Thousands of XML formats exist, in many different industries, to describe day-to-day data transactions:

title: Example: XML News
text: XMLNews is a specification for exchanging news and other information.

Using a standard makes it easier for both news producers and news consumers to produce, receive, and archive any kind of news information across different hardware, software, and programming languages.
